COFFEE CHIFFON CAKE
2 eggs, separated
1 ½ c. sifted cake flour
1 t. baking powder
½ t. salt
½ c. cold strong Kona coffee
⅓ c. milk
1/8 t. baking soda
2 t. vanilla powder
2 e. salad oil
Beat egg whites until foamy; gradually beat in sifted sugar. Beat until stiff and glossy.

Set remaining sugar, flour, baking powder and salt aside. Make a well in center of dry ingredients. Combine coffee, milk, baking soda and vanilla. Add salad oil and one-half the coffee mixture to dry ingredients; beat in.
Fold egg whites into batter gently but thoroughly. Pour into two greased and floured 8-inch layer pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Remove from pans; cool on racks. Fill and frost with any notable frosting. Yield: 8-10 servings.
